section.leadIn: To avoid doubt, different fees may be specified in respect of the same matter for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: different circumstances, purposes or cases; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: mercury, mercury compounds, mercury-added products or manufacturing processes of different types or descriptions.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Paid fee not refundable
section.content: A fee paid under this Ordinance is not refundable.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Immunity from civil liability

subsection.content: A public officer is not civilly liable for an act done, or omitted to be done, by the public officer in good faith in performing or purportedly performing a function under this Ordinance.
Subsection (1) does not affect any liability of the Government for the act or omission.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Admissibility of notice etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a notice or other document (however described)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: purporting to be a notice or document given or issued (however described) (collectively given) by the Secretary or Director in performing a function under this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: purporting to have been signed by the Secretary or Director (or a public officer authorized by the Secretary or Director to sign on their behalf).

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings, the notice or document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is admissible in evidence on production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the absence of evidence to the contrary—

subparagraph.content: is to be regarded as a notice or document given by the Secretary or Director (as the case requires) and as so signed; and
is evidence of the facts stated in it.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Service of notice etc.
section.leadIn: A notice or other document (however described) required to be given or sent (however described) (collectively served) under or for the purposes of this Ordinance is, in the absence of evidence to the contrary, served if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for service on the Director—

subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the Director and delivered to the Director’s principal office; or
it is sent to the Director by registered post addressed to the Director at that office;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for service on an individual—

subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the individual and delivered personally to the individual; or
it is sent to the individual by registered post addressed to the individual at the individual’s last known address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for service on a company—

subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the company and delivered by hand to an officer of the company; or
it is sent to the company by registered post addressed to the company at the company’s registered office within the meaning of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for service on a partnership—

subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the partnership and delivered by hand to a place in Hong Kong at which the partnership carries on business, and given to a person apparently concerned in the management of, or apparently employed by, the partnership; or
it is sent to the partnership by registered post addressed to the partnership at the partnership’s last known address; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: for service on a statutory body, a body corporate (other than a company), or an unincorporated body of persons (other than a partnership)—

subparagraph.content: it is addressed to the body and delivered by hand to a place in Hong Kong at which the body carries on business, and given to a person apparently concerned in the management of, or apparently employed by, the body; or
it is sent to the body by registered post addressed to the body at the body’s last known address.

section.name: s84
section.heading: Right of appeal

subsection.content: A person aggrieved by a decision specified in subsection (2) may appeal to the Administrative Appeals Board against the decision.

subsection.leadIn: The decisions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse to issue a permit under section 18, 20 or 22;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a decision to impose conditions under section 18, 20, 22 or 27;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse to renew a permit under section 27;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse to issue a duplicate of a permit under section 28;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a decision under section 30 to vary a condition imposed under Part 3 in respect of a permit;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a decision under section 31 to refuse to vary a condition imposed under Part 3 in respect of a permit;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a decision to suspend a permit under section 34;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a decision to cancel a permit under section 35;
a decision to give a disposal direction under section 39; and

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: a decision to refuse to vary a disposal direction under section 40.

subsection.content: An aggrieved person may make an appeal within 21 days after the date on which the person is notified of the decision concerned.
An appeal under subsection (1) does not suspend the decision appealed against unless the Director decides otherwise.
